org.jasig.cas.adaptors.x509.authentication.handler.support

Class ResourceCRLFetcher

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jasig.cas.adaptors.x509.authentication.handler.support.ResourceCRLFetcher
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CRLFetcher
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    LdaptiveResourceCRLFetcher

    @Component(value="resourceCrlFetcher")
public class ResourceCRLFetcher
extends java.lang.Object
implements CRLFetcher
    Handles the fetching of CRL objects based on resources. Supports http/ldap resources.
    Since:
    4.1

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected org.slf4j.Logger logger
      Logger instance.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ResourceCRLFetcher()
      Creates a new instance using the specified resources for CRL data.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      java.security.cert.X509CRL fetch(org.springframework.core.io.Resource crl)
      Fetch the resource.
      java.util.Set<java.security.cert.X509CRL> fetch(java.util.Set<org.springframework.core.io.Resource> crls)
      Fetches a collection of crls from the specified resources and returns a map of CRLs each tracked by its url.

      Fetch the resource.

      • fetch

        public final java.util.Set<java.security.cert.X509CRL> fetch(java.util.Set<org.springframework.core.io.Resource> crls)
                                                      throws java.io.IOException,
                                                             java.security.cert.CRLException,
                                                             java.security.cert.CertificateException
        Description copied from interface: CRLFetcher
        Fetches a collection of crls from the specified resources and returns a map of CRLs each tracked by its url.
        Specified by:
        fetch in interface CRLFetcher
        Parameters:
        crls - resources to retrieve
        Returns:
        map of crl entries and their urls
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - the exception thrown if resources cant be fetched
        java.security.cert.CRLException - the exception thrown if resources cant be fetched
        java.security.cert.CertificateException - the exception thrown if resources cant be fetched
